DOC.brief_summary: The purpose project examine effectiveness compute tomographic angiography ( CTA ) patient non-ST elevation acute coronary syndrome ( NSTE-ACS ) . People hospitalized situation often require angiogram assess heart artery . Recent advancement technology enable CTA clearly define coronary artery anatomy great accuracy guide treatment strategy select patient population . We investigate CTA may use , alternative conventional angiogram , risk stratification patient high risk NSTE-ACS . Patients eligible study high risk NSTE-ACS await angiogram . Enrolled patient undergo CTA prior angiogram . With CTA patient inject small dose X-ray dye ask lie still `` scan bed '' period 5-10 minute .
DOC.brief_title: Risk Stratification Non ST Elevation ACS With Computed Tomographic Angiography ( REACT )
DOC.criteria: High risk ACS 1 . Angina [ accelerate pattern prolong episode ( > 20 minute ) recurrent episode rest minimal effort within precede 24 hour ] ; ( 13 ) 2 . Elevated Troponin T ( ≥0.1 ug/L ) ECG change consistent ischemia [ ST depression ≥ 0.1 mV , transient ST segment elevation ≥ 0.1 mV ( < 20 minute ) ] ) ( 11 ; 13 ) Planned conventional invasive coronary angiography Age < 18 year lack consent Renal Insufficiency ( GFR < 60 ml/min ) Allergy contrast agent Refractory angina require urgent/emergent coronary angiography ( per treat physician ) Contraindication radiation exposure ( e.g . pregnancy ) Uncontrolled HR Previous CABG PCI/Stent Atrial fibrillation , frequent atrial ventricular ectopy ( > 1 / minute ) Unable perform 20 second breathhold
